paper_abstract: The lambda-theory H is obtained from beta-conversion by identifying all closed unsolvable terms (or, equivalently, terms without head normal form). The range problem for the theory H asks whether a closed term has always (up to equality in H) either an infinite range or a singleton range (that is, it is a constant function). Here we give a solution to a natural version of this problem, giving a positive answer for the theory H restricted to Combinatory Logic. The method of proof applies also to the Lazy lambda-Calculus.
paper_title: Solution to the Range Problem for Combinatory Logic
